title: National Neighborhood Data Archive (NaNDA): Street Connectivity by ZIP Code Tabulation Area, United States, 2010
alternative_title: NanDA Street Connectivity by ZIP/Tabulation Area US 2010
description: This dataset contains measures of street connectivity (how well streets connect with one another) within all United States ZIP code tabulation areas (ZCTAs). This includes measures of the number of street segments (links) and intersections (nodes) per ZCTA, street length within ZCTA, and indices representing overall connectivity within the ZCTA.
creator: University of Michigan. Institute for Social Research
provider: Healthy Regions & Policies Lab, University of Illinois, Urbana-Champaign
methods_variables: links, street lengths, nodes,  endpoints of links, Buffers, areas over which to calculate street connectivity, Circuits,  connected path along streets
data_variables: block density, block length, streets, nodes, zcta, n_streets , n_nodes, n_realnodes, zcta_area_sqmiles, sum_strintlen, n_blocks, linkNodeRatio, Alpha index ratio of actual circuits to maximum circuits, Gamma index ratio of total links fully in the ZCTA to the maximum possible number of
data_usage_notes: This dataset contains measures of street connectivity (how well streets connect) within United States ZIP code tabulation areas (ZCTAs). This includes measures of the number of street segments (links) and intersections (nodes) per ZCTA, street length within ZCTAs, and indices representing overall connectivity within the ZCTA.
